parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Ah if it isn’t the young Lord Cedric, I see you have returned. You look - \|\|\^
- so much like your father. What is it I can do for you? \|\|\^
I can't find Richard, I can't find him in the lower town. Is he here? \|\|\^
Slide the picture back to the right a little, and set opacity to 0.
We're going to be doing this for every emote! Make sure to wait 20 frames
before the next dialogue or the pictures will insta-change rather than
Oh well, I'm sorry to inform you that your brother is not here he is not - \|\|\^
- even in Hyde. Richard left for Payne a while back, he went to go fight - \|\|\^
- over there. You see the Princes' Army has only gotten stronger an so - \|\|\^
- Payne needs the help most. If you want to find Richard you will need to - \|\|\^
- travel to Payne. But stay and rest Cedric, you have been travelling - \|\|\^
I see things haven't been doing so well down here then. \|\|\^
No, they haven’t, we are constantly battling. Your father might be the one - \|\|\^
- who's lucky, he no longer has to deal with this. \|\|\^
King Aron's entry in the Journal was updated.

My Lord, Lord Cedric of Haffenden and King Dormato of the Kingdom of - \|\|\^
- Luthania are here to see you. \|\|\^
Ah let them speak, let them speak. \|\|\^
Your majesty, we have managed to secure your kingdom and free it from - \|\|\^
Yes, that is true, I am ever so grateful for returning the Kingdom of - \|\|\^
- Hyde back to its natural state. I only ask that you stay and help around - \|\|\^
- a bit before you continue on with your journey? \|\|\^
I guess we could stay for a while. Cedric looks like he could use the rest. - \|\|\^
- It would also be in the benefit of restoring the kingdoms. \|\|\^
Thank you so much we will forever be indebted to you. The Farming Fields - \|\|\^
- need restoration you can help out there. \|\|\^

Your majesty my brother and I are deeply grateful for your kindness and - \|\|\^

With all due respect your grace, I think you are making a mistake by - \|\|\^
- allowing these boys to stay here. They are going to create problems - \|\|\^
Well, these ‘princes’ that invaded Haffenden clearly have a strong enough - \|\|\^
- force to be able to take over entire kingdoms. We don't know their motives - \|\|\^
- What if they were looking for the Lords of Haffenden? \|\|\^
Slide the picture back to the right a little, and set opacity to 0.
We're going to be doing this for every emote! Make sure to wait 20 frames
before the next dialogue or the pictures will insta-change rather than
They are our guests. We can’t just turn them out. I couldn’t do that - \|\|\^
Well, I think what Lord Comyn is trying to say is that the armies that - \|\|\^
- took Haffenden from these boys could very well try and take Hyde from - \|\|\^
- you if these boys are what they are after. We should decide whether - \|\|\^
- to keep and protect them at the risk of a possible invasion or turn - \|\|\^
- them over and create an alliance. \|\|\^
Thank you, Lord Giffard. Yes, that is what I was trying and failing to say. \|\|\^
You think I should end the alliance we have with the Haffendens and form - \|\|\^
- a new one with the princes? \|\|\^
Well, it is an option your grace we could also just kill them and send - \|\|\^
- their bodies as a sign of good faith. \|\|\^
These are some extreme options you are suggesting. Each outcome will have - \|\|\^
- will have a lasting effect. You two are being awfully quiet, what are - \|\|\^
Well, I think we should honour our current alliance. I mean what happens - \|\|\^
- if we side with these princes and then the Haffendens then reclaim their - \|\|\^
- kingdom? We would be in an awkward position. \|\|\^
Lord Craon is right we can’t risk making an enemy of our current allies. - \|\|\^
- We should honour our alliance and work together to reclaim Haffenden. - \|\|\^
- Or… we can send them away to another kingdom so that we aren’t involved. - \|\|\^
Okay, I have heard enough we will need to come to a decision. Until then - \|\|\^
- the boys are not to be harmed. \|\|\^

You called for me your grace? \|\|\^
Yes Cedric I did. I wanted to let you know that I am sending you off - \|\|\^
- to Rinsar to help fight the battle over there. \|\|\^
Why? Isn’t that a bit dangerous? \|\|\^
It’s safer there than it is here. The Princes Army is now at the city - \|\|\^
- gates, the battles will commence soon. The advisers who told you to - \|\|\^
- leave in fear this would happen will want your head. In Rinsar they - \|\|\^
Yes, I am King but these are powerful lords, if I upset too many I could - \|\|\^
- see civil war breakout. I can’t fight a two-front war right now. I have - \|\|\^
- been in communication with the eldest Prince of Rinsar, he will take you - \|\|\^
- in, for now, as long you help him. \|\|\^
Oh well, I guess I should be on my way then. \|\|\^
I’m sorry it came to this Cedric. But rest assured the man who arranged - \|\|\^
- your attack will be found and dealt with and that you will return home - \|\|\^

So what are your thoughts regarding Cedric now? \|\|\^
I have to say he has surprised everyone who has been watching him. Which - \|\|\^
He has been a great help to Hyde. We wouldn’t have Hyde back without him. \|\|\^
The two of you were against keeping him and his brother, yet they have - \|\|\^
- been a catalyst in the liberation of the kingdoms in the realm. And - \|\|\^
- you Lord Altard? You had the idea of killing them and sending them to - \|\|\^
- the princes of Rinsar. Yet they are alive and the princes haven’t been - \|\|\^
Well if it’s anything I certainly no longer wish them dead. They may - \|\|\^
- actually be of benefit to this kingdom. \|\|\^
Well it is something. I should have had the lot of you put to the sword - \|\|\^
- after the stunt you pulled with Cedric the last time he visited. \|\|\^
I agree your grace. Last time was a tragedy but Lord Orlebar and I have - \|\|\^
- expressed support to Cedric and his brother since they first set foot - \|\|\^
That is true. I just wanted to see where you all stood on the matter. - \|\|\^
- Now that we all seem to be on the same page I believe we can move forward - \|\|\^
- with rebuilding Hyde. And should any of you ever dare go against what - \|\|\^
- I have said I won’t hesitate to remove you. \|\|\^

I should probably go take a look at the farming fields you mentioned. \|\|\^

It’s ridiculous! They are trying to seize power from us. We can’t trust them! \|\|\^
We just got our kingdom back and now we’re expected to just hand it over - \|\|\^
Those are valid points. What do you think Lord Altard? \|\|\^
I am against this! We should kill them and send them to Dormato as a sign! - \|\|\^
That’s cold. But no I will not kill them. \|\|\^
I think your grace you should accept their proposal. We can prosper as - \|\|\^
- a kingdom if we are part of this larger collective. \|\|\^
It worked before. It can work again. \|\|\^
I need time to think on my own. Everyone out! \|\|\^

Cedric Haffenden. I feel betrayed. I took you and your brother in against - \|\|\^

- come here to take what’s mine? \|\|\^
It’s not? Then what is it like? \|\|\^
We are only trying to make the realm a better place for people. We think - \|\|\^

I don’t know Cedric. I will think about it. \|\|\^

Your majesty Lord Cedric and Lord Richard of Haffenden are here to see you. \|\|\^
Ah, you have returned, I have to say you two have proven to be noble just - \|\|\^
- like your father was. But anyway, what is it you want? \|\|\^
We came to propose that you join the Kingdom of Odaria. \|\|\^
Like I said my two young lords you have proven to be noble and I am grateful - \|\|\^
- for all you have done for Hyde but the answer is no. \|\|\^
I just got my kingdom back I’m not going to give it up. But I’ll tell you - \|\|\^
- what, if you defeat my chosen warrior I will join, if you lose you will - \|\|\^
Cedric don't, you don't know what you're up against! \|\|\^
Richard trust me, I'll be fine. \|\|\^
